item.description: Slowloris Attack Slowloris is an application layer Denial-of-Service (DoS) attack running on Application layer of the OSI model (OSI Layer 7). The attack allows the attacker to overwhelm a target HTTP server by exploiting the internals of the HTTP protocol. How normal HTTP request-response works? In normal scenario the client opens a TCP connection after which it sends the text information for the request. Each of the request lines are terminated by \r\n sequence.
